intro: Marsdenia lucida, commonly known as the shining Marsdenia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent yellow corona. Marsdenia lucida is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
